 Besides another classmate said that he had seen them selling

woman in the group and it was expected of me.

I am a school teacher. At a teacher-parent meeting I received a  
good deal of positive feed-back on my work both from the parents  
and through them from the pupils.

A scene in a film in which one man repressed another one. By  
concidence, their position was reversed. The other man was  
repressed in an identical way as he did before.

When I knew that a person who I didn't like, had about me other  
feelings.
Whhen the front tyre of the car burst.

We had a birthday party with 5 friends. One of us frequently used  
hard drugs. On the party I discovered that the other 3 friends  
also used them. While we agreed we would help the big user to  
stop using it.

I had gone on a vacation and my mother left home without leaving  
me any thing - money to come back to school.

After a pleasant evening with friends in my flat, one of them did  
not want to leave, because he wanted to sleep with me. He said  
that he had fallen in love with me, that he felt alone and so on.

After a long time (of no communication with him, physical  
illness and worry) my lover came to see me, when I least expected  
to see him.

I was alone walking in a deserted part of the city and I had some  
fear that some men would attack me and rob me.
Being treated unfairly.
Falling in love.
A sunny Autumn day, after a long rainy period.

When I understood that my marriage was falling apart, and we  
decided to be legally separated.
When I triffled with other people.

While drinking a soft drink, I had the impression of swallowing    
a piece of glass so I went to the district hospital and got  
admitted there.
When my sister died in a fire accident at home.

At school, when the only thing people my age could think of was getting  
rolling drunk. They couldn't have a good time without firstly  
getting drunk.

The stories about my aunt who was beaten and humiliated by my  
uncle.
Had to tell people that my parents are divorced.
I saw a sort of black worm being attacked by many ants.

When I hooked a girl in Kitwe.  She was very beautiful for my  
standards, a rare bird of this kind accepted me as a boyfriend.

My son lives in the country. I feel sadness when I see mothers  
having walks with their children.

In form three we were taking our mock exams and someone else (a  
friend) was making noise when the examinateur picked on me and  
said that he would tear up my answer sheet.  I got very angry

Found my name on the list of attending the English lectures.

The cat of my landlady escaped through the window which I had  
left open.

I was disgusted when I was told to dress a big rotten stinky  
wound which, coming closer, made me feel like vomitting.

Recently, some friends and I had too much to drink while on a  
foot-ball road trip to USC. We trashed our hotel room and I felt  
ashamed when the maid walked in the next morning.

When one has arranged to meet someone and that person arrives  
late, in the meantime one starts thinking about all that could  
have gone wrong e.g a traffic accident.
When I am at home alone.
China winning the Asian Olympic games.

I was sitting on the bus coming back from school. A man from  
nearly forty years sat beside me. After a while I looked at him  
and saw that he was looking at me with opened throusers and  
holding his penis.

I had not eaten anything for 2 days to be able to pay the fine

thousand shillings in the restaurant during the same time.
A TV program on whale-hunting.

My friend was so intoxicated that the police came and took him  
away, and they later contacted his parents.

I felt shame when I didn't study enough for my exams and as a  
result I failed. I then invented idle stories to talk it good for  
myself and the others.
I was angry when my abilities of a singer were underestimated.

A truck (big one) nearly mowed me off the road (I was driving a  
small Lazer).
When grandfather died.

When my elder sister had a baby girl.  She was the first girl in  
the family after 19 years of baby boys.

Girlfriend arriving back from overseas and picking her up from  
airport. When she finally appeared from customs and we came in  
contact again.

Slept in a chapel and in the middle of the night I realized that  
there was someeone else in the chapel.  I never discovered who  
it was and why he was there.

A good friend quitted me after he had behaved in a strange  
manner.
Got through first semester University.

A friend (female) and I were on holiday on Great Barrier Island  
by ourselves. One night we were nearly raped by about 20 locals -  
they came to our bach and tried to break the doors down. All of  
them were stoned or drunk and we hid under the bunks and were  
totally terrified. Eventually these guys gave up and went looking  
for us on the beach. We escaped and slept in the bush for 2  
nights.

When I was the target of a great many insults and completely  
unfair accusations of a large group of people.

When I heard that I was not to be provided with another pair of  
medical uniform.

When I see children on T.V from areas devastated by drought and  
war.

Badly chosen words to a vague acquaintance of mine made me feel  
ashamed at having given the wrong impression about what I wanted  
to say.  Thoughtlessness.
When I was caught stealing money from my father.

During my holiday I met again a friend who had tried to commit  
suicide. She had just left hospital, her lips were trembling, she  
looked miserable.

When I was at a party I met an old friend from an adult  
education course.  We had not met for 2 years but had both thought  
a lot about each other.  A wonderful experience.

When a certain boy went about saying that I am his girlfriend. I  
wrote him an insulting letter to him and called him names.

When I laughed at a lame man walking down the road, it looked  
funny at the time but later I felt lousy.  It was the same day  
that I had stolen some coins from my mother in the shop.

When someone pointed out that I was proud, yet I didn't dress up  
properly. This was when I and my friend went for a dnce one  
Saturday.

When I got a first class in the twelveth standard exams, I was very  
surprised and happy and I had a very good time with my friends.

Having to go back home form the U.S. after having been there for  
ten weeks to visit my brother and his family.
Finding out about Chinese money cannot buy foreign journals.

Recently, my sister-in-law's horse was poisoned by a plant and  
died. The horse was very obedient and exceptional with children.

My brother wanted money but I refused to give it to him, two days  
later he stole it from my father.

I felt shame at the hurt I caused to my family especially my  
parent father, shame of hurting people emotionally. A misconceived  
self-blaming that didn't do me any good. Shame at being myself as  
I am.

At the weekend I wanted to be absent from school because of a  
sports event, but my teacher refused to give me the day off  
because he didn't like me.

When I almost did something awful with a friend of mine and  
myself.

When I heard that I had passed Primary School Leaving Certificate  
and was selected to go for Secondary education.

I felt shame when I saw someone I knew and pretended not to see  
her. Later she saw me and said hi.

I felt guilt because on account of my ambitions I nearly turned  
my sister out of my parents home.

When I was very young, one day, I was in the street with my  
father and brother.   While my father was talking to some  
friends, I saw a dog and began to pat it.  My father told me  
sharply to stop doing it because the dog had mange.  Then my  
brother told me that I would die and I could not stop crying  
after this.
Cheating in a minor geography exam at school.

No specific instances - perhaps having lied as a child resulting  
in someone else being blamed for the event.
When my mother left for Kenya.

This was the worst incident of my hostel life.  I was insulted by  
a close friend of mine on the eve of the New year and it totally  
spoiled my New year's night.

A person with whom I had been on bad terms, gave me a present. We  
became reconciled.

I was very sad when I did not get admission in the English  
college, as I had 1% less marks than they wanted.

My roommate being nice to a party leader in order to get into the  
party.
Deceived by other people and ran into trouble.

On the way back from Denmark with a friend on a small yatch,  
there was a storm and my friend was blown overboard;  I was very  
scared till I managed to get him back onboard.

Thinking of the unknown, what happens at the moment of death,  
etc.

About two years ago my girlfriend suggested that we separate.   
This really gave me a shock as I had never thought that she would  
say such things.  The reason she gave me was that we were not  
suited for each other.

My peers didn't want me to meet someone during rush for fear that  
I would give her a bad outlook on our Sororoty house. I shouldn't  
have seen this, but they blew and I did.

My feelings towards would-be in-laws for their participation in  
recent broken relationship.

When I don't say the truth, when I don't do a certain thing  
thanks to my laziness.

I had asked the Salvation Army to take away a piece of furniture  
of mine, but I forgot to cancel the agreement (a friend of mine  
took it) and I thereby caused the Salvation Army people some  
unnecessary work.

When my grandfather died I was extremely sad.  However my family  
members did not have any special feelings, they said that he was  
already 80 years old.

When I was accused of having planned my friend's outing at  
secondary school (boarding) as we were not allowed to go out.
When I got indecent offers.
When a thunder belt hit the roof top of the building I was in.

I had known the girl for a few months when I proposed to her and this  
put an end to our friendship, as from then on we started  
withdrawing from each other.  I liked her very much.

When I had been obviously unjustly treated and had no possibility  
of elucidating this.

A girl asked me why I didn't dance. I told her I was ashamed to  
dance. I felt myself ashamed having to tell her this.

My boy-friend told me that he would take me to the training of  
the life-saving dogs.

I received the results of the test paper of my major subject and  
I found that my result was not as good as a classmate who had  
recently changed his major subject.    I felt very ashamed.
Found out my wife is pregnant.

When a drunkard barged into a room where my friend and I had run  
in order to get away from him.  We were all alone and all I could  
see was this hand coming towards me.

My son was apprehended for shoplifting at the age of 14. Because  
I too had been apprehended at the same age I felt the shame of  
not having been able to prevent my son from acting in the same  
way.

In Biarritz (the South of France) I met some English students  
who, especially for me, went to Paris and gave me food, while I  
didn't have any more money.

Some colleagues decided to go out on a Saturday not inviting me  
to decide either the place nor the time.

Two summers ago my best friend and I drove into unknown mountains  
at midnight to pick up my broken car. We told one another  
horrifically scary ghost/murder stories and succeeded in scaring  
eachother pretty well - even though somewhere in our heads we  
knew the fears were unjustified.

I didn't like my former fob and felt joy when I received a  
telegram offering me a new one that I though better and for which  
I had been waiting.

I was to meet one of my friends (girl) at the library at 8:00  
already dark. She would be walking alone. She was 45 minutes late  
but I kept waiting, calling her room and other places she could  
have been.
When I got first division in the exams before leaving school.

When the time came for me to see dead bodies and to operate on  
them.

My mother and my grandmother were talking about one of my  
grandmother's friends whom I hardly know. I gave some deprecatory  
comments on him whereupon my grandmother told me that the man had  
died recently.

A time when I was very afraid of something was when I broke my  
father's antique lamp.

When my ex-girlfriend and I discovered that there was a certain risk  
of her being pregnant.

When I was convinced that someonne had broken into my flat and I  
woke up and heard sounds that frightened me.
When bathing at surf beach & lost togs.

Climbing a mountain where the rocks were very loose. When we  
realized the danger, we were very high up, but still had a long  
climb ahead.

I saw a drunk man tottering behind his wife and insulting her  
awfully.
I was scared in the dark when I was a little boy.

When I was in a bus on my way to the examination centre, a man     
sitting opposite me kept looking at me continously.  I did not know   
what was wrong.  When I reached the  centre I started strolling around   
as I still had a little time.  Suddenly a man came and whispered "You   
have forgotten to zip up your trousers."  I was at a loss to say anything   
and I felt very embarrassed.  When I thought of the bus incident I felt   
even more ashamed.
Being told that I have not got a personality.

I had made an appointment with a girl to go to the movies, but  
actually I had no mind when we arrived at the cinema, it was a  
full house. I then went back and she went to the movie alone.

I was very happy when I passed and went to form I.  It was a  
great relief for me as I had been very worried considering the  
large number of pupils who fail.
When my grandfather died.

When I splashed a child by not slowing down while driving  
through a puddle of water.

I was very happy when my scholarship to continue studying at UNZA  
was approved after it had been cancelled.

After the funeral of an acquaintance I felt very depressed. That  
feeling turned into joy when I heard that I had achieved a good  
grade for an examination.

I took the tram without paying. There were many people around me  
when I was caught by a controller. I felt ashamed but also angry.
Telling my parents that I did not get into a good university.
Had an insulting letter from my father.

I worked together with another student on a computer-assignment.  
She didn't do her best and didn't prepare herself for it. She  
expected me to explain it to her.
Seeing a person panhandling money on Telegraph.

At school a classmate who was a very good pupil had to help  
another boy who performed less well. He told him on purpose the  
wrong things so that he had to repeat a year.

An incident occurred to me when I was going home with my  
girlfriend. On the way, a man named Banda grabbed my girlfriend  
in my presence. I was really angry with him and as a result I  
threw stones at him and he ran away.
When I tried to steal a book from the bookshop and was caught.

When I was at home alone, I felt a super-natural force, dangerous  
for me and the people close to me.
When my girlfriend became pregnant.

When I was substituted in a play which was to be staged, after I  
had learnt all the lines.

Quite recently I realized that I had had some erroneous views  
about life. For instance, I had always lived for other people,  
had forgotten my own person and suppressed my own feelings. I was  
ashamed because I had not been concious of that until I had a  
conversation about it with a person.

When I got through the examination for my driver licence, and  
when I finished I knew I had passed it.

Sometime back, my boyfriend and I were having a walk nearby my  
parent's house. Suddenly we met my grandfather and I was  
afraid that he would report to my parents.
The birth of my daughter.

I was sleeping when I heard the neighbours screaming, I peeped  
through the window and saw a thief  trying to enter my  
neighbour's house.

One day I took my playmates to the river to swim and play. One  
of them was epileptic so he drowned into the water. I felt guilty  
because it was me who took them there.

When I was selected to start Form I at Chilumba Secondary School  
out of the 100 pupils I was among the 4 who were successful.  
Family History showed that I had done better than all my brothers  
who had passed after repeating for several times.

The day before the university results came out I was both excited  
and scared.  If I failed I did not know what I would do as I did  
not want to work, my family was ambivalent.
When a friend of me came for an unexpected visit.

When I was dancing with a dame at a social, one of my friends who   
was interested in her came and took her away from me.  I was  
really angry with him then.

A bus drove over my right leg.  The event itself was not very  
frightening but when I had to wait in the emergency ward for  
three hours and then my leg began to swell, I was frightened.
Held under water by a large wave and thought I was drowning.
I was sexually assaulted one night by a stranger.

I had to call someone and make an appointment for a conversation.  
I was very afraid to fail.
South Korea cheating for gold medals.
A too eager approach by a dirty drunken person in a bus.
In summer when I was sailing with friends in Greece I felt joy.
When I dated my friend's boyfriend after they had broken up.

During my Highschool time I was chairman of the student's  
comitee. In this function I once had to make a speech to a large  
audience and I was very nervous. After three sentences I forgot  
my text.

When people/press analyze a particular newsworthy item (CAL  
Football team) which I am a member and can only see the situation  
in a bad light and always put the team down.

It was the time when I was in no position to secure a Ist class  
in the M.Sc exam and this was likely to affect my career.

I had a schoolmate who went to the hospital as her brain was  
bleeding.  She fell unconscious for three days and when I went  
to see her I saw the miserable state the family was in.  Moreover

died.

When I was offered a high position of trust, which I later  
accepted.

One day I shouted at my brother who didn't do any wrong to me  
only that I had a disappointment from a friend and projected it  
on to him. He cried and I felt guilty after sometime.
I kicked the chair in the classroom to express my anger.

My son's mother told me that she wanted to move to Vienna and  
take the child with her. This means a rather long distance for  
me. My whole family was sad and dumbfounded so that my own  
feelings were intensified.
When my flute-teacher was replaced by a new one.

When I was detained one day in school, by the vice-principal, for  
indiscipline.

To have a friend who I didn't see for months, and under the  
circumstances that I met him made me feel happy, and perhaps  
because it has been one of the good things that I learned with  
this friend.

I got into a tight pair of trousers and examined myself in the  
mirror.  My back looked unpresentable and I felt ashamed at my  
wanting to wear those clothes that day.  I quickly changed into  
another dress.

When I had not prepared my contribution to the group as  
thoroughly as the other members, with the result that the  
overall result was poor.

It was last week on Saturday night when I was at Mchesi. I feared

A very drunk person.

When my roommate and I had dinner together we decided as to who  
would clean the bowls.  One day when I came back from school I  
found that she had not cleaned up.  Since I had to cook dinner I  
cleaned them myself and felt unhappy and disgusted.
A pig in the well from which we drink.
I was called racial slurs behind my back.

This week I was phoned by an old friend with whom I lost contact  
a few years ago.

While trying to get my little brother over a ditch, he fell on  
his head and started crying.  I was scared of having caused him  
permanent injury.

Winning a rowing race at a Karapiro regatta. With 7 other  
friends.
A theft committed by me.
Love problems.

Sometime back I came across a certain man who was badly beaten by  
some people because he was found raping the wife of the village  
headman.

When my sister lost my favourite jumper at a party and failed to  
tell me for several days after it happened.
Found out that I am not good at football.

turned on her and kicked her over the heart, sent her flying

When a boy tried to fool me so he would be OK trying to show me  
that he is a gook boy.

A holiday at a whitesand deserted beach. A cool evening near the  
end of summer and we had a fire in the sand - toasted  
marshmellows, cuddled and drank champagne.

One night I had to bike home all alone after a party. Then I  
found out that I was pursued by a man in a car.
When I masturbated in my room.

A person I trusted a lot gave me many false explanations to  
justify a wrong action.

I felt joy when I passed the worst phase in my life and  
discovered how many people considered me important to them.

When I forced a close friend of mine to ask a girl things about  
herself.

I think I felt ashamed for the first time when I entered a night  
club.

Once, when I arrived home very late, my parents had an argument  
because of this; my mother wanted to stand up for me.
Going out alone in the dark.

On a boat trip to Denmark, 14 of us had a lot of fun and we  
spent SEK 10 each on one armed bandits and against all odds we  
won the jackpot of SEK 1000.

I went to the prayer meeting at night and unfortunately the car  
broke down, so my other sister said I had to walk alone from  
Ndirande to Chirimba at around midnight. So we reached home at  
1 am. I was afraid of robbers and dardness.

From the cigarette smoke. Usually I feel disgust from it when I  
am in a restaurant.
Emotional reassurances by spouse.

I had subscribed for this test. We were informed by our  
secretary where the test took place. We went over there and thought

secretary again should see me.

My father had been involved in a car accident two years ago.  I  
was then very scared thinking that he would die as he lay  
unconscious in hospital for two weeks.

After a weekend at a seminar I saw my husband again. I hurried  
home hoping he would be there. We embraced - I enjoyed feeling  
his body.
When I was walking in a field which had a lot of manure.
When I lost something that was valuable to my sister.

I was overwhelmed with joy when I received the acceptance letter  
to UNZA.  This happened again when I passed all my first year  
courses.

I was very happy when I found out that I had passed with flying  
colours and that I had made it to the university.

The death of Jaya Prakash Narayan caused a great deal of sadness  
as I believed that he was the only true democrat and a ray of  
hope on the Indian horizon.
Being chosen to do this experiment.

I felt disgust toward meat when I felt sick with the steak after  
a week only on meat.

I had told a person unpleasant things in a bad manner. He was  
very depressed and caused an accident.
When I thought that I had failed the examination.

Last Summer I was walking along the beach in a bikini and an

When my daughter gave her solo dance performance in Poona and  
there was a big applause, I was overjoyed.
Unjust accusations directed at me and my way of acting, by someone close to me.

I blew up at someone for being confused and because of his  
irresponsibility and afterwards I felt guilty and that I had no  
right.

I did a solo flight from Ardmore to Kaikohe before I got my pilot  
licence. I can remember it was gorgeous day and I was on a  
natural high, cruising up the coast with my maps and compasses  
and gear. Other pilots had seen me off and wished me good luck  
and it was a real adventure.

I once saw a programme on TV describing how certain wild life  
films were made and was disgusted by the treatment of certain  
animals in this particular programme of the polar bear.

I got a letter from my best friend, whom I had not heard from for  
a long time (a good letter).

When I was in Eindhoven on an Exhibition of Hernan Nitsche, who  
made paintings with real blood. There were also photographs about  
the killing of cows.

My boyfriend was playing with my cat. He was playing games with her  
and telling nice things to her.
When a close friend died.

When I had to prepare and read a paper to my fellow students but  
I didn't cope with the task.

I felt guilty when I had refused to lend money to my friend who  
needed it immediately.

Once I was alone at home. I suddenly felt unwell and there was no  
one to help me and call First Aid.

I felt guilty when I skipped a two hour practical class I knew I  
would miss out on more information which I did not know, but I  
couldn't cope with going.

I was to meet a girl in a discotheque.  She was very pretty and I  
was very happy.  But she did not turn up.  Thank God, there were  
some other friends there and I was able to have a more or less  
good time.

After I was thrown out of a car in an accident, this resulted in  
a fracture.
Finding out that I am not an as able student as I thought.

I was in the living room at home with an ex-boyfriend, it was  
nearly a year that we had separated, during the talk he began to  
remember our courting and gave me a long kiss.
When I was accepted as a student.

In the traffic I insulted a man who crossed my way. Afterwards I  
paired with him, and felt shame because of mine lack of pacience  
and ridiculous attitude.

With the N.Z. Rugby Union wanting to send the All Blacks to South  
Africa.

While studying chemistry with a friend we became angry with  
eachother because we were both fed up.
I scolded my sister without waiting for her explanation.

Some boys talking about nicknames of the lecturers, and I was too  
afraid of them to stop them.

Joy for me is when all my family gather around home for special  
occasions as Christmas etc. It really gives me joy to see my  
family and relatives and to observe natures productivity process  
which have been going on for centuries.

I was travelling, we were 15 person, one of them I met at the  
travel and didn't like her. One night I was asleep while she and  
her friends were talking too loud in the kitchen. I got up to ask for  
silence and since that day I felt constant disgust for her.

I got up late and I could not go to my lessons on time.  When I  
entered the class room the stare of the teacher and my classmates  
made me feel guilty.

When I applied for the college entrance examination to FUVEST,  
and I wasn't approved in the second fase.
Watching China winning the Asian Olympic games.

This feeling I sensed quite recently. It was arisen by the  
terrific thought that I might lose the man I loved !
Following an argument with my brother, he broke my golf clubs.
Listening to my roommate boasting about her new clothes.
I said something which was against my conscience.

I was filled with joy when I heard that I had been selected for a  
University course.

I was disgusted with the hypocrisy of my colleagues from the  
group.

An argument among several friends because of the irrational  
behavior of one of them who fell out with us for no reason and  
said that we were to blame.

When I lied to my best friend about a boy she really liked but he  
didn't like her. I told her he did and she bugged him for a long  
time embarrassing herself.

I am not good enough to join any team to play sport for the  
class.

While playing basketball I broke a team member's spectacles.  His  
face was injured by the  pieces of glass.  It was not serious but  
I felt guilty and blamed myself for being too careless and  
vigorous in my game.
Talking with a nice girl.

I was afraid of moving away from home and moving to Helsinki for  
my studies.
When I have been overhastingly offending or hurting.

For example, when I have promised something but I haven't  
fulfilled it.
I was not chosen for the All English class.

Before an accident, my aunt offered me the front seat of the car,  
next to the driver. I declined, she took that seat and was killed  
there when the car crashed.

My teacher asked me a question which I failed to answer and I was  
told to stay behind after the class and give the answer after  
studying it from a book.

One day at school I had quarrelled with a school-mate, and  
ultimately I had hit him hard.  He, being physically weak had to  
visit his doctor and remain absent from school for two days.
During my last exam.

My father had a complicated operation. A long time before and  
also a long time after that, we did not know how he would get  
over it. During all that time I felt very sad.

When I argue with my boyfriend, I feel as though he feels  
superior to me.

When I hadn't studied for an exam, so I pretended to be sick so I  
wouldn't have to go to school. I lied to my mother - she realized  
I had been lying when she got home from work and found that I had  
been over to a friend's place.

When my mother went through an operation, it was not very serious
